sen.j: 兼松 房治郎（かねまつ ふさじろう、弘化2年5月21日 (旧暦)（1845年6月25日） - 大正2年（1913年）2月6日）は、日本の実業家。
sen.e: Fusajiro KANEMATSU (1845 June 25 - 1913 Febrary 6) was a Japanese bussinesman.
Fusajiro KANEMATSU (1845 June 25 - 1913 February 6) was a Japanese businessman.

sen.j: 父が行方不明となり、12歳で母親を扶養するため伏見西浜の醤油、味噌などを商う葭屋に丁稚奉公する。
sen.e: As his farther went missing, he started working in the store of soy sauce and miso in Fushimi Nishihama to support his mother. Next year he briefly lived with Enzo who ran Tanba in Shintenmachi. Afer a while, he visited Kyoto and lived in the dried food shop of Shobee Funaya in Higashinotouin Manjuji.

sen.j: しかし翌年、大阪の縁戚で新天満町丹波屋延蔵方に住む。
sen.e: However, next year he moved to live with his relative in Osaka who was known as Tanbaya Enzo in Shintenmamachi.

sen.j: しかし続かず、しばらくして京都に赴き、東洞院万壽寺の鮒屋庄兵衛の乾物問屋に住み込みとなった。
sen.e: The arrangement didn't last long and after a while, he went to Kyoto and became a live-in worker in the dried food shop of Funaya Shobee in Higashinotoin Manjuji.

sen.e: In 1858 when Kanematsu was 14, he quit the shop and lived in a candle shop in Kyoto where he didn't do well and once again quit. Then Kanematsu started working with Magotaro who was a rice dealer in Edobori Gochoume, due to the introduction of Tanbaya.

sen.j: 明治維新前後は大阪、横浜などで綿糸・雑貨の商業に従事し、明治6年（1873年）から明治14年（1881年）まで三井組銀行部大阪支店に勤務、取締役兼堂島米商会所重役となる。
sen.e: Around the Meiji Restoration, he did the business of cotton and general merchandise in Osaka and Yokohama, and from 1873 to 1881, he worked at the Osaka branch of Mitsuigumi Ginkoubu and became the CEO and executive of Dojima Rice Shokaisho.

sen.e: Around the Meiji Restoration, he was engaged in the business of cotton and general merchandise in Osaka and Yokohama, and from 1873 to 1881, he worked at the Osaka branch of Mitsuigumi Ginkoubu (currently known as Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation) and became the CEO and executive of Dojima Rice Market Firm.
sen.cmt: Ginkobuだけでは職種がわかりませんので補足しました。商会所もそのままではわかりませんので修正しました。堂島米商会所の定訳不明です。

sen.j: 明治15年（1882年）大阪商船創設に参加、取締役となるが、明治19年（1886年）辞任。

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）同新聞を本山彦一に譲り、神戸に兼松商店（のちの兼松江商、現兼松）を創設、日豪貿易に従事。
sen.e: In 1889, he gave the administration to Hikochi MOTOYAMA, and founded Kanematsu Shoten (later known as Kanamatsu Esho, Kanematsu) and worked in the trading between Japan and Australia.
